Strip paste filling technology This technology adopts a strip mining method of 8m extraction and 24m retention, with a uniaxial compressive strength of the filling body not less than 4.6MPa, allowing for advantages such as a support column that is not easily weathered, low compressibility, lower filling costs, wide applicability, and high extraction rates.

Strip support technology This technology uses the support method of 'anchor rods + rebar mesh + anchor cables', allowing for increased density of anchor rods and anchor cables and local reinforcement with steel strips and anchor cable beams when the roof is fractured.

Paste filling material technology This technology requires an initial slump of 250±20mm, a pumpable time of no less than 2 hours, a bleed rate of less than 3%, and a uniaxial compressive strength of no less than 4.6MPa.

The conditions result in a large area of ground collapse zone formed in the goaf and its influence range, with the mining of the #3 coal seam leading to strip-like or oval-shaped surface subsidence. The conditions are a coal seam thickness of 8.27 to 10.41 meters, with an average of 9.13 meters, using the longwall comprehensive mechanized mining method, with an average burial depth of 230 meters and a loose layer thickness of 70 meters. Surface subsidence monitoring station arrangement technology This technology is applicable for monitoring collapsed areas, with a longitudinal observation line of 4913.3 meters, a dip observation line of 690 meters, and a measurement point spacing of 15 meters, enabling comprehensive monitoring of surface movement.

High-Precision Monitoring Instrument Technology This technology uses first-level RTK dynamic measurement, with GPS plane position accuracy of ±(5mm + 2×10^-6) and elevation accuracy of ±(10mm + 2×10^-6). The precision of the TOPCON AT-G2 level instrument is 0.4mm.

Staged observation technology This technology is divided into three stages: pre-sampling observation, in-sampling observation, and post-sampling observation. The monitoring period is three years, with observations conducted once a month. If the cumulative subsidence value is less than 30mm over six consecutive months, it is considered stable.

Longmen Coal Mine is a mine with extremely complex hydrogeological conditions, with the main water hazard being karst water damage in the Cambrian limestone at the bottom of the coal seam, where the hydraulic pressure of the cold grey water ranges from 3.61 to 4.26 MPa, and the average thickness of the aquiclude in the working face is 50 meters. Under these conditions, mining will face the threat of a water influx coefficient greater than 0.06 MPa/m, which may lead to water disaster accidents at the working face.

the Cambrian limestone aquifer has strong water enrichment properties, with a unit water inflow of 11.006 L/(s·m) and a permeability coefficient of 124.4 m/d. Under these conditions, grouting will face the challenges of uneven development of karst fissures and a large amount of grouting required, which may result in high costs for water damage control.

Grouting Technology This technology is suitable for mines with large water volumes, using a cement + yellow mud mixed grouting, with an initial slurry specific gravity of 1.20 to 1.25 t/m³, which can be increased to 1.35 t/m³, and a grouting pressure of up to 15 MPa, with a daily grouting capacity of 400 tons.

Stratified grouting technology This technology is applicable to multi-layer aquifers and involves pre-grouting of the L1-4 limestone of the Taiyuan Formation to achieve multi-layer grouting reinforcement, thereby increasing the compressive strength of the bottom plate and the thickness of the waterproof layer.

The conditions are as follows: the coal seam floor is relatively flat, the coal seam dip angle is between 1° and 3° (average 1.6°), the length of the working face is between 115 m and 126 m, and it is affected by faults (with H between 0 and 18 m). The conditions involve a harsh underground environment, requiring data transmission and control. Mixed communication technology This technology utilizes a combination of wireless (infrared communication, Bluetooth communication) and wired (CAN bus, RS-485 interface) transmission methods, enabling stable data transmission in underground environments.

Bracket Controller Technology Using the STM32F407ZGT6 microcontroller CPU, which integrates power circuits, color screen modules, drive output circuits, CAN communication circuits, analog signal acquisition circuits, etc., it can achieve precise control of the bracket.

Multi-mode control technology It includes three modes: remote operation, centralized control operation, and adjacent rack operation, which allows for full automation control of the rack. The adjustment time for a single rack is 10.24 minutes, with an adjustment accuracy within ±4mm.

Under the condition of the 212 return air descending the limestone tunnel, it is necessary to link multiple working faces for ventilation, including the +1325m south wing transport roadway, 51408 transport slope tunneling face, 51406 comprehensive mining face, and several other areas. The conditions are a tunneling length of 140m, a cross-sectional area of 12m², and an estimated construction time of 60 days. Gas monitoring technology This technology installs gas sensors at key positions, triggering an alarm and cutting off power when the concentration reaches 0.4%, and completely cutting off power at 1.2%, achieving real-time monitoring of gas concentration.

Dust prevention and reduction technology This technology uses dust prevention pipelines, with a three-way valve every 50 meters, employing wet drilling and water cannon mud, and installing spraying devices at each transfer point for dust suppression.

Gas emission technology This technology discharges gas in the order of the 212 return airflow down the Shimen excavation face → the 515 auxiliary transportation down the excavation face → the 515 return airflow down the excavation face → the 51408 transport parallel slot excavation face, controlling the airflow by adjusting the offset of the air duct joints.

The ore is relatively soft, producing a large amount of powdery ore after collapse, and contains 3% to 7% chlorite. Under these conditions, when the powdered ore encounters water, it forms clumps, significantly reducing the flowability of the ore, severely affecting the development of the discharge ore ellipsoid, making it difficult for the collapsed ore to be released smoothly, thus impacting the discharge efficiency and frequently causing chute blockages.

There are two sources of water infiltration in the mining area: water from the F8 fault and infiltration of accumulated water from the abandoned mined area at the 1613m level. Drilling drainage technology Using 80mm diameter drilling, a total of 21 medium-deep holes will be drilled, of which 17 holes are 15m deep for draining accumulated water in the upper empty area, and 4 holes are 20m deep with an inclination angle of 70° for fault dewatering.

Drainage system design technology In the access route and lower-level connecting roadway, construct drainage ditches with a slope of 0.3% to 0.5%, hang a water storage container at the drainage hole outlet, and guide the water into the drainage ditch through a diversion pipe, finally draining into the 1595m horizontal water accumulation chamber.

The workshop is equipped with 239 30W fluorescent lamps and 176 40W fluorescent lamps, which were put into use in 2012. the mining electronic workshop needs to carry out precision operations such as soldering and assembling electronic equipment. Under these conditions, the operation will face challenges such as insufficient illumination brightness and poor uniformity, which may result in low work efficiency and product quality issues.

LED lighting technology This technology has an energy efficiency of over 90%, a lifespan of more than 50,000 hours, no flicker or radiation, pure light color, and high color rendering. Its energy-saving effect is significantly better compared to traditional lighting fixtures.

LED lighting fixture retrofit technology This technology reformats a 30W fluorescent lamp into a 12W LED tube (equivalent to the illumination of a 36W fluorescent lamp) by removing the central electronic ballast, and a 40W fluorescent lamp into a 16W LED tube (equivalent to the illumination of a 50W fluorescent lamp).

the coal seam burial depth is between 700 to 1200 meters, with current mining activities located at -670 to -1050 meters level. the tunnel is located in the floor layer of the third coal seam, with a rock type consisting of grayish-white fine-grained sandstone, clayey cementation, interspersed with multiple thin layers of siltstone, exhibiting wavy bedding, well-developed layer joints, and a blocky structure. Anchor mesh + shotcrete + grouting support technology This technology is applicable to Class 5 unstable tunnels, using 20mm × 2400mm anchor rods, 21.6mm × 4200mm anchor cables, 100mm thick C20 strength grade sprayed concrete, combined with water glass concrete grouting (for the sides and bottom) and resin material Marisane grouting (for the roof).

Composite anchor cable support technology This technology uses three steel strands with specifications of 17.8mm and a length of 12.5m as combined anchor cables, along with one steel plate each measuring 400mm×400mm×16mm and 200mm×200mm×12mm.

Shallow and deep combined grouting reinforcement technology This technology includes shallow (3m) and deep (6m) grouting, with 9 grout holes arranged per section, a spacing of 3m between rows, a spacing of 2m between holes, a diameter of 42mm for shallow holes, and a diameter of 28mm for deep holes.

the eastern dam body of the tailings dam is at an elevation of 1263m, which will reach 1268m by the end of the year, and the western dam body is at an elevation of 1268m. Pipeline system optimization technology Using D245×15 seamless steel pipes as tailings transport pipes and discharge pipes, the flow rate is v=3.06~4.59m/s, which is greater than the street sedimentation flow rate and has a certain surplus, ensuring safety and reliability.

Joint Development System Technology This technology adopts a combined development approach of sloped ramps and vertical shafts, setting up a main shaft, a secondary shaft, and four production mid-levels (-200m, -250m, -300m, -350m), capable of achieving an annual production scale of 700,000 tons.

Composite mining method technology This technology selects the sequential empty stope backfill method (60%) and the upward horizontal layered backfill method (40%) based on the surrounding rock conditions, suitable for mining sections with different surrounding rock conditions.

Multistage Pump Station Drainage System This technology includes the -70m and -142m pumping stations and the open-pit bottom pumping station, capable of handling a normal inflow of 30,000m³/d and a maximum of 39,600m³/d.

Single-layer mining void treatment technology This technology is suitable for single-layer void treatment, using vertical detection holes (160mm diameter, 24m depth, 18m×12m hole grid) and peripheral blast holes (160mm diameter, 14~18m depth, 6m×4m hole grid), and employing mixed emulsion explosives for blasting.

Side wing oblique hole sequential treatment technology This technology is applicable for situations where the thickness of the goaf roof is less than the minimum safety thickness. Final Step Reconstruction Technology This technology is applicable to the mined-out area beneath the final slope, adopting a combination of pre-splitting blasting, buffer blasting, and small differential blasting, with a pre-splitting hole spacing of 1.4-1.6m, a linear charge density of 0.9-1.3kg/m, using No. 2 rock emulsion explosive.

Long-short hole combination blasting technology This technology is applicable to pre-cracked seams on the roof, using a combination of long cut holes with a spacing of 500mm and depth of 10m, along with short cut holes of 3m, at an angle of 15° to the vertical, forming bidirectional energy-collecting tensile blasting.

Deep Hole Loosening Blasting Technology This technology is applicable for increasing the influence range of roof loosening by creating blasting holes and achieving loosening of the roof rock mass through vertical inclination.

Periodic fracture blasting technology This technology is suitable for controlling the collapse step distance on the side of the thick, hard roof, with the seam cutting direction at a right angle to the long and short hole blasting direction.

Tunnel Reinforcement Support Technology Using 2 rows of constant resistance large deformation anchor cables (φ21.8mm×12300mm) + 6 rows of glass anchor rods (φ18mm×1800mm) + anchor mesh and single support pillars, with the side support using resin anchor rods (φ16mm×1600mm).

the mountain area of the mining district has been subjected to extensive mining, resulting in the formation of 12 high and steep slopes, among which the height difference of slopes HSBP01-HSBP03 ranges from 3 to 61.86 meters, with slopes of 40-68°. the area of vegetation destruction in the mining area has reached 38.47 hectares, resulting in 6 abandoned sites covering an area of 64.49 hectares. Edge trimming and slope shaping technology This technology is suitable for the management of steep slopes, achieving slope stabilization by controlling an elevation of 85 meters and a total cut volume of 35,151.6 cubic meters (including an excavation of 1,757.6 cubic meters and a rock cut of 33,394 cubic meters).

Buttress wall technology This technology is suitable for preventing slope collapses, implemented through a 177-meter long, 6-meter high reinforced concrete retaining wall, with a wall width of 0.5 meters and a foundation depth of 1.5 meters, achieving slope reinforcement.

Vegetation restoration technology This technology includes soil greening, planting hole method, and the method of climbing downwards, achieving ecological restoration by planting trees such as masson pine and black locust (spacing 1.5 meters × 1.5 meters) as well as climbing plants (spacing 0.5 meters).

the inclined length of Well No. 1 is 477.57m with an angle of 23°, and a dual-track system has been arranged, with a maximum piece weight of 35,000kg. Wire rope technology Use 40ZBB6V×34+FC1670ZZ962648 steel wire rope with a diameter of 40mm, a nominal tensile strength of 1670MPa, a minimum total breaking force of the steel wire of 1132kN, a safety factor for major components increased to 7.02, and the safety factor for gangue lifting is 18.75.

Lifting technology Using the 2JKB-3.5×1.7P type single-rope double-drum winding mine explosion-proof hoist, with a drum diameter of 3500mm, maximum static tension of 170kN, and maximum lifting speed of 2.88m/s, equipped with a 560kW AC variable frequency motor.

Electric control and signal system Using a 1140V variable frequency electric control device, which has protection functions for short circuit, overload, and loss of pressure, equipped with a slope shaft operations and lifting signal system, to achieve semi-automatic, manual, and maintenance operational modes for the hoist.

The conditions involve complex fault block and fault lithology oil reservoirs in the study area, which have entered the later stage of exploration and development. Numerical simulation technology based on wave equation This technology is applicable to complex structural areas. By using finite difference forward modeling to analyze wave field propagation characteristics, it can determine the optimal distribution range and arrangement length of the shot points, with a maximum shot detection distance selected to be between 3500 and 4800 meters.

High-density wide-directional collection technology This technology uses the 32L8S260R observation system, with an element size of 12.5m×12.5m, a coverage count of 208 times, receiving 8320 channels, and a maximum detection distance of 4706m, increasing the density of detection channels by more than double compared to the old plan to 133.00×10^4.

Collection design based on fusion processing. This technology arranges a new detection line in the middle of the existing detection line, offset by 6.25m, forming a 6.25m (longitudinal) × 12.5m (transversal) surface element. The conditions are the special geological conditions of the three soft coal seams, including soft coal seams, soft floor, and soft roof, characterized by high porosity and ease of fracturing. the initial mining area contains three exploitable coal seams (3-2 coal, 5-1 coal, 5-2 coal), with interlayer spacing of 22.26 to 30 meters and a coal seam dip angle of 17° to 28°. Technical layout planning of the mining area. Work face optimization layout technology This technology arranges 30 working faces (10 for each coal layer), with a working face length of 160 to 200 meters, utilizing staggered arrangement (30 meters stagger between coal seam 5-1 and coal seam 3-2, and 15 meters stagger between coal seam 5-2 and coal seam 5-1) to achieve safe mining of multiple coal seams.

Mining pressure monitoring technology This technology achieves real-time monitoring of surrounding rock deformation and support effectiveness by deploying equipment such as top plate separation instruments (one every 50m), bolt strain gauges (one set every 100m), borehole strain gauges, laser range finders, and hydraulic support pressure gauges.

The relative outflow of gas from the No. 15 coal seam at Shanxi Shigang Coal Mine is 77.14 m³/t, and there have been incidents of coal and gas outbursts, making it a mine prone to such occurrences. The average dip angle of the coal seam is 7°, with an average thickness of 7.18 m. Under these conditions, coal mining will face the risk of coal and gas outbursts, which may lead to safety accidents.

Chip indicator method prediction technology This technology assesses the risk of outburst by measuring the amount of cuttings S and the gas desorption index K1, comparing them with the safety critical values (dry coal K1 is 0.5 mL/(g•min1/2), S is 6 kg/m). It predicts a borehole diameter of 42 mm, a depth of 10 m, and a spacing of 15 m.

Advanced Emission Drilling Technology for Gas Prevention This technology employs a double row arrangement of three flower eyes, with a spacing of 2m and an angle of 4°. Each row has 16 advanced discharge drill holes, totaling 32. After drilling, a discharge of at least 8 hours is required.

Measure Effect Verification Technology Use inspection drilling (diameter 42mm, spacing 15m) for effectiveness inspection, ensuring a reserved advance distance of 2m for inspection holes, an advance distance of at least 3m for normal zone support measures, and an advance distance of at least 5m for geological structure zones.

The conditions include a rich water supply from the K2 limestone layer, with a maximum inflow rate reaching 216 mL/s, causing water to flow into the excavation space of the 10# coal seam through the 9# coal seam, resulting in water dripping from the roof. Under these conditions, the support will face challenges such as the washout of anchoring agents and reduced bonding performance, which may lead to a decrease in anchoring strength and the continuous damage of the support structure.

the A3015 working face coal seam is a Class II self-igniting coal seam, with a natural ignition period of 65 days, including the wind oxidation zones of overlying coal seams A4, A6, A7, as well as the old empty area of coal A4. Under these conditions, there will be challenges related to spontaneous combustion of residual coal in the mined-out areas and CO leakage to the working face, which may pose a threat to safe production at the working face.

the working face has a strike length of 802 meters, a dip length of 180 meters, an average coal seam thickness of 3.1 meters, and a dip angle of 5° to 23° (average dip angle of 12°). Under these conditions, as a steeply inclined caving working face, there will be challenges related to the complexity of air leakage channels in the goaf and the difficulty of fire prevention and extinction, which may lead to the diffusion of CO leakage in the fire area.

Section parallel boosting (equal pressure) technology This technology achieves a maximum pressure increase value △h of 400Pa by installing two booster fans in the transport lane and setting up adjustable air windows in the return air lane, allowing it to shield and force the fire hazard away from the work area.

Dragging tube nitrogen injection technology This technology involves laying two DN100 steel pipes parallel to the roadway floor at the lower corner of the working face (one 15m and the other 45m), continuously injecting nitrogen through the piping into the deep extraction area to achieve fire prevention without fire and fire extinguishing with fire.

The conditions for Zhao Zhuang Coal Mine's No. 3 coal seam are low ash-medium ash, ultra-low sulfur-low sulfur, and medium low heating value-ultra-high heating value anthracite, with an average selling price of 500 yuan/t; the No. 15 coal seam is medium ash, medium high sulfur, and medium high heating value anthracite, with a maximum selling price of 310 yuan/t. Under these conditions, the separate extraction of the No. 15 coal seam will face the challenge of poor economic benefits, which may result in a loss of 4 yuan per ton of coal.

The conditions are influenced by the geological structures of the Wulonggou normal fault and the DF68 reverse fault, with a displacement of 0 to 50 meters for the Wulonggou normal fault and a displacement of 0 to 20 meters for the DF68 reverse fault. Under these conditions, the development will face restrictions from faults on the layout of the development system, which may affect the rationality and safety of the production system.

Optimization Technology for Proportioning and Blending This technology determines that the No. 3 coal seam is allocated 6.0×10^6 t/a and the No. 15 coal seam is allocated 2.0×10^6 t/a through linear programming, with an allocation ratio of 3:1, ensuring that the mixed sulfur content of the raw coal after allocation is controlled at 0.89%.

Partitioning development technology This technology utilizes the existing +560m level, arranging the belt stone gate and auxiliary transport stone gate in the five-pan district tunnel, employing a '2 in, 2 out' four-tunnel layout to develop the XV one-pan area, achieving a layered and zoned independent system.

Packaging and Distribution Technology This technology arranges three circular vertical coal bunkers with a diameter of 9.0m each, with a total capacity of approximately 6000 tons, to achieve the separate loading, transportation, and timed lifting of the No. 15 coal seam and No. 3 coal seam underground.

the west return air shaft of Zhao Gu II Mine passes through the alluvial layer at a depth of 704.60m, with a bid design freeze depth of 820m, making it one of the thickest shafts in the country and abroad that passes through the alluvial layer. Under these conditions, construction will face the challenge of relatively thick wall thickness, which may lead to economically unreasonable consequences and affect the quality and safety of the masonry.

The conditions include a large proportion of the wellbore passing through cohesive soil layers (accounting for 89.47% of the alluvial layers), a relatively high underground water flow rate in the alluvial layers (11.52 m/d), and a significant amount of water inflow into the wellbore (1074.45 m³/h). Under these conditions, the construction will face significant challenges in difficulty, which may affect the project schedule and construction safety.

C100 High-Performance Concrete Well Wall Optimization Technology This technology is applicable to the design of ultra-deep alluvial layer well walls, reducing the wall thickness of wells at depths of 432-767m from 2100mm to 1750mm by increasing the concrete strength grade to achieve wall thinning.

Optimization technology for freeze hole arrangement This technology is applicable to the design of freezing schemes for deep alluvial layers. By optimizing parameters such as freezing depth (reduced from 820m to 783m) and freezing wall thickness (reduced from 10.6m to 10.3m), the volume of the freezing project can be reduced.

Wellhead temperature control technology This technology is applicable to the freezing construction process, achieving real-time monitoring and regulation to maintain the well wall temperatures of the clay layer and the sandy layer at above -11℃ and -13℃ respectively, ensuring the safe formation of the frozen wall.

The conditions are for soft rock tunnels, with a direct roof consisting of sandstone with a strength of 16.1 MPa, containing a high content of clay minerals, and well-developed joints and fractures; the direct floor is composed of mudstone, with a softening coefficient of 0.59, which easily expands when wet. Under these conditions, supporting will face challenges such as difficult roadway maintenance and high repair rates, which may significantly impact important processes such as roadway excavation continuity and transportation.

The conditions are a tunnel depth of 204 m, with a rectangular return airway cross-section (net width 4200 mm × height 2800 mm), and the roof has a significant thickness of oil shale layer with poor interlayer cohesion. Under these conditions, the support will face challenges such as the thickness of the suspended rock layer being large, and the anchoring sections of the anchor cables being located in weak oil shale, which may result in overall bending and sinking of the rock layers within the anchor cable anchoring area, with a maximum sinking amount of 40 cm and a maximum lateral displacement of approximately 30 cm.

High pretension long anchor cable 'inverted trapezoid' support technology This technology arranges slanted high-prestressed long anchor cables at the two shoulder corners of the roof, with two vertically arranged high-prestressed long anchor cables in the middle. The length of the anchor cables is 8.3 m, and the anchoring end is located in a hard sandstone layer.

Assist in strengthening support technology. This technology increases the diameter, length, and support density of the auxiliary anchor rods to enhance their support strength, addressing the issue of vertical fissures developing in the coal body.

The conditions indicate that the roof and floor strata of the coal seam have developed fractures, with relatively low uniaxial compressive strength, classifying them as soft rock. Under these conditions, carrying out roadway preservation will face the challenge of significant deformation on both sides of the tunnel cross-section, which may lead to serious impacts on underground safety and normal production.

I-beam shed + single-column support technology This technology uses a spacing of 0.8m between I-beam trusses, a spacing of 0.5m between individual columns, with the columns firmly secured to the ceiling and the support point for the columns set slightly above the middle height of the passageway.

Wood stack + high-water material filling technology A 1.5m wide U-shaped filling bag containing high-strength filling materials is used beside the roadway, supported by two rows of hydraulic props, with a column spacing of 1.5m and a row spacing of 0.8m.

Timber Stack + Concrete Block Support Technology Using a combination of 1.5×1.5×1.15m concrete blocks and wooden stacks, along with a combination of anchor mesh and anchor cables for support, single columns are arranged on the goaf side.

The conditions involve mining thin coal seams at close distances, with an average thickness of 4.2m for the 4# coal and 3.6m for the 5# coal, and an average interlayer spacing of only 10m, characteristic of typical thick coal seams in close proximity. The mining depth is nearly 500m. Under these conditions, the excavation of the roadway will face challenges such as the upper coal seam mining disrupting the integrity of the floor, the lower coal seam lacking complete direct and basic roofs, which may result in consequences like the development of joint fractures in the surrounding rock, looseness and fragmentation, severe deformation, and extensive damage.

High pre-tension asymmetric support technology This technology is suitable for excavation along the empty lane, using a bolt pre-tensioning force of 70kN and a cable pre-tensioning force of 120kN. The combination of bolts and cables increases the internal friction angle and cohesion of the rock mass, with the roof cables arranged closer to the mining area side to achieve asymmetric support for the passage.

Narrow coal pillar reinforcement technology This technology is suitable for reinforcing coal pillars along the空掘巷 by using a 17.8mm diameter, 4200mm long anchor cable, with a spacing of 1500mm×1700mm, combined with used channel steel to form a simple truss structure to reinforce the 8m wide coal pillar and implement grouting reinforcement.

Trinity Support Strategy This technology integrates three aspects: ceiling suspension, control assistance, and narrow coal pillar reinforcement. It achieves comprehensive support by using long anchor cables for ceiling plates, increasing overall integrity with anchor bolts, and enhancing the overall strength and rigidity of coal pillars with anchor cables and channel steel.

the upper coal mining causes damage to the roof of the lower coal seam, with an average interlayer distance of 2.0m and a lower coal thickness of 1.7 to 2.1m. Under these conditions, the excavation of the recovery tunnel will face challenges such as roof collapse and difficult support, which may lead to destructive consequences such as roof fall and side wall squeezing.

the degree of rock layer destruction varies with different interlayer spacings. When the interlayer spacing is 0 to 1.5 meters, the rock layer is severely fragmented overall. In the range of 1.5 to 2.5 meters, there are relatively intact areas. When the spacing exceeds 2.5 meters, the integrity in the middle portion is relatively good. Under these conditions, differentiated support schemes need to be adopted for different interlayer spacings; otherwise, it may result in poor support effectiveness and excessive tunnel deformation.

Borehole inspection detection technology This technology is used to detect the damage status of the roof rock layer, utilizing the YTJ-20 rock detection recorder to observe the distribution of roof cracks and changes in thickness.

Anchor bolt pull-out test technology This technology is used to test the anchorability of the top plate, utilizing BHRB400 high-strength threaded steel anchor bolts (φ20mm) for pull-out tests to verify the anchoring capacity under spacing conditions of 1.0 to 5.5m.

Partition support technology Different support schemes are adopted based on the interlayer spacing: for less than 2.6m, a combined support system of anchor mesh and single column + π beam shed is used; for 2.6m to 5.2m, a combined support system of anchor mesh and single column + pressure signal shed is used; for greater than 5.2m, anchor mesh + anchor cable support is used.

both the shaft bottom yard tracks have formed stone gates and the main transport stone gate, and the bottom elevation of the roadway is basically the same (+1255m). the existing main transport stone gate equipment has been put into operation. Under these conditions, the modification will face the challenge of not being able to make significant adjustments to the equipment parameters, which may affect the normal operation of the transportation system.

Tunnel roof support technology This technology adopts a combined support method of anchor bolts (⌀18mm×2000mm) + steel mesh + anchor cables (⌀17.8mm×10500mm) + sprayed mixed concrete, with the maximum open roof size at the intersection of the tunnel being 5.4m×5.4m.

Belt conveyor modification technology This technology transforms the horizontal section of the conveyor into a top-sag arch section (maximum sag height of 1.4 meters) by adding structural components such as support frames, special bodies, and crossbeams, with a convex arc curvature radius of 150 meters and a concave arc curvature radius of 300 meters.

the wellfield is cut by the F22 normal fault (with a drop of 0 to 350 meters) and influenced by limestone, and the second-level tunnel cannot pass through the F22 fault. The conditions are a two-level hydrogeological type of medium, with a normal inflow rate of 220 m³/h and a maximum inflow rate of 290 m³/h. the well bottom car park is located within the mudstone and fine sandstone of the No. 51 coal seam floor. Under these conditions, the layout will face the challenge of surrounding rock stability, which may result in tunnel deformation or support failure.

Zone development technology This technology is applicable to the fault segmentation area. To the east of the F22 fault, it uses additional auxiliary shafts and extended inclined return air shafts, with coal transported to one level via the inclined tunnel or stone gate.

Horizontal parking lot layout technology This technology uses a north-south entry and exit vehicle method, with the new auxiliary shaft vehicle azimuth angle at 196°, and the yard transportation capacity reaching 1571 kt/a, with a surplus coefficient of 6.1.

Anchor mesh spray cable support technology This technology is applicable to the support of tunnel corridors in the depot, with a double-track tunnel cross-section of 5.4m × 4.3m and a single-track tunnel cross-section of 4.6m × 3.9m.

Large capacity drainage system This technology includes an internal and external combined water chamber (effective volume of 1760m3) and a main drainage pump house, meeting the storage requirements for 8 hours of normal inflow.

The conditions are as follows: for the 5-2 coal seam of Hongliu Forest Coal Mine, the thickness is about 6 meters, with a hardness of f value 2.7 to 3; for the 4-2 coal seam, the thickness is about 4 meters, with a hardness of f value 1.8 to 2.2, and the roof is mainly composed of fine-grained sandstone. The conditions are for a coal mine with an annual production of 15 million tons, featuring large cross-sections of tunnels, including large-section coal roadways such as advance tunnels and support removal roadways. the excavation support equipment is outdated, the support efficiency is low, and excavation and support cannot operate in parallel. Continuous miner/arm-type tunneling machine + integrated support operation platform technology This technology uses 8 hydraulic anchor drilling machines installed on protective supports, achieving a monthly advance of over 600 meters.

Slope surface deformation monitoring technology Using the Australian SSR-XT type 3D true aperture radar, the monitoring accuracy exceeds 1mm, the range resolution is no greater than 0.375m, the azimuth resolution is no greater than 10mrad, and the equipment's annual online rate is no less than 90%.

Hydrological monitoring technology Use a water level meter and seepage pressure gauge to monitor groundwater levels and seepage pressures, with a multi-channel data acquisition terminal for information collection and network upload.

Blasting vibration monitoring technology Monitor the blasting vibration velocity of the foot of the temporary slope surface in the main sliding direction of the slope, focusing on the monitoring sections laid out around the pit's current slope conditions.
Video image monitoring technology Use high-definition wide-angle network cameras with an image resolution of over 4 million pixels, and ensure that video data is retained for no less than 30 days.

The condition is to store approximately 4.2 tons of expired waterproof emulsified drug rolls for about 180 days in a civil explosive storage facility. Detonation testing technology This technology conducts comparative tests by drilling four 1.5m deep boreholes, each containing 3kg of qualified explosives and 3kg of expired explosives, to verify the explosive performance of expired explosives through the comparison of blast pile shapes.

Open-pit deep hole step blasting technology This technology uses a hole diameter of 160mm, a hole depth of 13m, and a hole grid parameter of 5×5m, employing a triangular hole arrangement. Double insurance blasting technology This technology involves connecting a detonating cord in series within the borehole, loading 15 kg of powdered emulsified explosives into each hole, and setting up two separate detonators and two combination qualified explosives connected as the initiating charge.

the floor of the working face has developed karst fractures in the upper segment of the Taiyuan Group limestone, with a water pressure of 3.25 to 4.15 MPa and a static water level of -190.5m. the working face is located in hydrological geological unit III, with a burial depth exceeding -500m. Under these conditions, if conventional grouting is used to modify the groundwater layer of the base plate, not only will the safety be low, but it will also consume a large amount of grouting and drilling costs, potentially leading to a significant increase in the costs of water disaster management at the work site.

Water discharge testing technology This technology conducts experiments by placing observation and drainage holes to obtain hydrological parameters such as unit water inflow (0.013~0.042 L/s·m) and permeability coefficient (0.32~0.50 m/d), evaluating the aquifer's drainability.

Dynamic drainage discharge technology This technical design presents different equivalent drainage flow schemes (67~112 m³/h), calculating the drainage effect through non-steady flow theory. At a drainage intensity of 100 m³/h, the water level can be drained down to the coal seam floor in 51 days.

The conditions are poor engineering geological environment and low strength of the surrounding rock in the tunnel. The condition is uneven deformation of the surrounding rock. Under these conditions, the support will face the challenge that the U-shaped steel brackets may not be effective, which could lead to the failure of the support structure.

The conditions are a deep high-stress environment. Under these conditions, the support will face the challenges of stress redistribution and stress concentration, which may result in a deterioration of the tunnel's load-bearing capacity.

Hollow Grouting Anchor Support Technology This technology uses a hollow grouting anchor cable with a diameter of 21.6mm and a length of 8m, paired with a high-strength arched tray of 400mm × 400mm × 15mm, with a pre-tensioning force of no less than 250kN and a grouting pressure of 5MPa to 7MPa.
Anchor rod support technology This technology employs a 2.3m long anchor rod, which can effectively control the deformation of the surrounding rock and save support costs.

the tunnel is buried at a depth of 763 to 852 meters, with severely fractured surrounding rock. The conditions are characterized by complex geological conditions at the working face, with a large number of faults and the superimposed effects of anticlines and faults. The conditions include a tunnel distance of 2097.468 m, extended maintenance time, and a large tunnel cross-section. Under these conditions, the support will face the challenge of significant difficulty in controlling the surrounding rock, which may result in unsatisfactory support effectiveness.

Anchor cable mesh spraying support technology This technology achieves deformation coordination through the coupling of anchors, injections, net-supporting rock, and anchor cables supporting critical parts, limiting harmful deformation and damage to the surrounding rock, thus realizing the integration of support and uniform load distribution.

Full-length anchoring technology This technology is applicable to the top support; compared to the 1.5 m end anchoring scheme, it can more effectively control slip shear damage and improve the integrity of the rock mass within the anchorage range of the cable.

Asymmetrical anchoring technology for the base plate This technology is suitable for bottom support, using 4 m anchor lengths, without the need for steel beam support, making it more economical and effective than asymmetric steel beam and symmetric non-steel beam options.

The conditions are as follows: the length of the E2311 air inlet chute is 2005.270m, the length of the E2311 belt chute is 1833.932m, and the distance of the through cutting eye is 325.5m. the tunnel environment is complex, requiring consideration of the effects of passing mine cars and pedestrians, as well as the stability of the tunnel roof. Wire layout technology This technology uses a 30″ level mining area control guide wire, with guide points spaced 100 meters apart, and anchors the measuring nails to the ladder beams of the tunnel roof using anchoring agents.
Measurement Instrument Technology This technology uses the Leica TS09 PLUS total station for underground electro-optical wire measurement operations.

the mine contains 9 coal seams (No. 1, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, and 11), among which the No. 6 and No. 10 coal seams are the main extractable seams, with an annual production of 1.19 million tons and a gas outflow of 98 m³/min from the mine. Inclined interlayer drilling technology This technology is suitable for Coal Seam No. 6, with a drilling angle of 38°, a length of 64m, a borehole diameter of 270mm, and a final hole diameter of 20mm. Wall-mounted pipe extraction technology Suitable for gas extraction in the goaf of No. 10 coal seam, the thickness of the stone wall on both sides of the closure wall should not be less than 300mm, and the total thickness of the closure wall should not be less than 2.5m, equipped with valves and gas concentration detection equipment.

GPS Class D network measurement technology This technology is suitable for ground control measurement, utilizing a satellite elevation angle of 15°, with ≥4 effective observation satellites, a static period length of ≥45 minutes, a data sampling interval of 15 seconds, and a fixed error of 10mm, capable of establishing a high-precision ground control network.

Axial flow fan technology This technology uses the GAF 26.5 axial flow fan, with a blade adjustment range of 40° to 50°, an efficiency of up to 87%, a fan speed of 990 r/min, and is equipped with a 1600 kW variable frequency electric motor.
